name: Empirical Financial Economics
description: The course develops the tools used in empirical research in financial economics. Coverage may include discrete choice models, duration models, instrumental variables, differences-in-differences, regression discontinuity, propensity score estimators, sample selection models and cumulative abnormal return calculation. Topics are drawn from ownership structure, mergers and acquisitions, capital structure, payout policy, CEOsâ€™ effect on the firm, executive compensation, insider trading, shareholder activism, and bank financing.
